Topic Outline: Understanding Progress Payments: A Guide for Homeowners Under the HIA Contract

I. Introduction

* Explanation of the importance of understanding progress payments for homeowners under the HIA contract
* Brief overview of the common issues in dispute between homeowners and builders regarding practical completion under a residential building contract in NSW (Common Issues)

II. The HIA Contract

* Explanation of the HIA contract and its relevance to progress payments and practical completion
* Definition of practical completion and its importance in the HIA contract
* Explanation of the differences between practical completion and final completion

III. Progress Payments

* Explanation of progress payments and their purpose in the HIA contract
* Discussion of how progress payments are calculated
* Explanation of the risks associated with non-payment of progress payments by the homeowner

IV. Practical Completion

* What is practical completion?
* How long does practical completion stage take?
* When is practical completion achieved?
* Explanation of the importance of the notice of practical completion and its contents
* Analysis of latent conditions commonly found in new builds vs renovations

V. Handover

* Explanation of the handover process and its significance in the HIA contract
* Discussion of the risks associated with improper handover by the builder

VI. Disputes and Resolutions

* Explanation of the common disputes that arise between homeowners and builders regarding progress payments and practical completion
* Discussion of possible resolutions and dispute resolution mechanisms available to homeowners and builders under the HIA contract

VII. Conclusion

* Recap of key takeaways for homeowners under the HIA contract regarding progress payments and practical completion
* Final thoughts on the importance of seeking legal advice in disputes with builders

Word Count: 1,300
